channel.title: Travel News | Top Europe Destinations & Holiday Ideas | Mail Online
channel.description: Get the most out of your holidays with Daily Mail. Learn about top Europe destinations and everything you need to know about travelling Europe.

image.title: Travel News | Top Europe Destinations & Holiday Ideas | Mail Online

item.title: Inside the festival that turns British countryside into the Wild West
item.description: MailOnline's Laycie Beck put on her line-dancing shoes for The British Westerners Association's 'Spring Round-Up' festival, featuring 'fast draw' contests and lassoing.

item.title: Tenerife's rock stars! Discover the island's dramatic volcanic landscapes and lava sculptures
item.description: Martin Symington heads on a self-guided walking tour of three 'contrasting' parts of Tenerife, beginning at San Miguel de Abona and finishing at the Teide National Park.

item.title: Florida holidays: Dodge the Disney hordes and head to Vero Beach for old-fashioned charm
item.description: During their stay in Vero Beach, Jane Alexander and her son take a boat ride around the Indian River lagoon, try 'gator tail' bites at a local bar and shop for vintage clothes.

item.title: Pictured: The stunning £70million superyacht shaped like a giant knife
item.description: Unique 71 by SkyStyle - which has offices in the USA and Spain - has been designed to penetrate water 'like a blade'. One notable guest feature is a water-level dining area.

item.title: New York From The Air: Photobook takes readers on a 'breathtaking journey' across an iconic skyline
item.description: With over 200 pictures taken from helicopter and rooftop vantages, book New York From The Air takes readers on a 'breathtaking journey' across the iconic skyline.

item.title: Cruise holidays: Exploring the Caribbean on Viking Octantis, Viking's new Polar-class vessel
item.description: Lesley Bellew boards Viking's Polar-class vessel Viking Octantis - which offers learning opportunities as well as top-class dining - for a trip around the Caribbean.

item.title: FAA will keep its zero tolerance policy for unruly passengers even as mask requirements expire
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) said on Wednesday the agency's 'zero tolerance policy' for addressing unruly passengers will become permanent.

item.title: Northern Territory mum who travels ten hours to go to Woolworths and Kmart goes viral on TikTok
item.description: Ell Regan, 28, lives in Barkly homestead in the Northern Territory and travels 450 kilometres across the Queensland border to Woolworths and Kmart in Mount Isa to fetch her groceries.

item.title: Woman complains that her boyfriend spends 'all of his free time' digging a TUNNEL on his property
item.description: A 27-year-old woman posted anonymously on Reddit, writing that her 31-year-old boyfriend has spent about a year working on his 'remarkably deep' tunnel.

item.title: Professor Sprout's greenhouse from the Harry Potter films to open at Warner Bros. Studio Tour London
item.description: The magical greenhouse will open at Warner Bros. Studio Tour London - The Making of Harry Potter on July 1 as part of a brand-new feature, Mandrakes and Magical Creatures.

item.title: Moment a bear wriggles through a tiny garage window in search of food in Tahoe [Video]
item.description: Footage filmed by Brooke King shows the enormous bear clinging to an opening at the top of a garage across the street from her in South Lake Tahoe, California, on April 18.

item.title: The 10 most wish-listed Airbnb castles in the UK revealed from Cornwall to Scotland
item.description: With the Queen's Platinum Jubilee fast approaching, now's the time to get into the spirit of the occasion - with a stay in a UK castle for a taste of life as a royal.

item.title: 700-year-old SHIP discovered beneath the streets of Tallinn was part of the Hanseatic League
item.description: The 80ft-long vessel, thought to be a 13th-century Hanseatic cog, was found during construction work in the Estonian captial.

item.title: Paris holidays: The joys of the city's outskirts, from a royal graveyard to Chinatown
item.description: Most people's idea of Paris is a compact area in the centre. Simon Heptinstall took day trips to discover greater Paris, from St Denis in the north to Vitry in the south.

item.title: How second homeowners became the most hated people in Britain
item.description: Tempers flared again over the bank holiday, as residents in tourist meccas hit out at rich Londoners for treating the towns like 'Chelsea-on-Sea'.

item.title: U.S holidays: Enjoying the adventure of a lifetime in Alaska, home to glaciers and wondrous wildlife
item.description: Humphrey Hawksley flies to Anchorage and explores the country by foot and by catamaran, cruising through College Fjord and following the trails of the Chugach mountain range.
item.media:credit: Shutterstock / Amanda Mortimer / Shutterstock / nathaniel gonzales / Shutterstock / Marina Riley / Shutterstock / travelwithelaine

item.title: Storybook-style chateau in LA with a VERY romantic history hits the market for nearly $6 million
item.description: Known as the Chateau Lemoine, the 4,500-square-foot property is nestled in the Mid-Wilshire District's Brookside neighborhood, just minutes from Hollywood.

item.title: Ten feet alligator takes an early morning stroll through residential neighborhood in Florida
item.description: Sarasota Sheriff's deputies captured video of a large alligator crawling through a front yard in Florida before making its way through a neighborhood and into Harrington Lake in Venice on Sunday.

item.title: Maldives hotel review: Inside Siyam World, the biggest, newest resort in the archipelago
item.description: Tamara Hinson checks in to a one-bedroom villa with a private garden at Siyam World, a resort that 'caters for families and those looking for a more affordable Indian Ocean break'.

item.title: Exploring Israel's ultra-hip restaurants, palatial hotels and ancient religious sites
item.description: Jake Wallis Simons and his fiancee started their tour of Israel in Tel Aviv, before venturing north to Acre. They also visited the Dead Sea and went on a thrilling desert buggy drive.

item.title: Beautiful new book reveals the world's most amazing gardens, from Britain to the US
item.description: Amazing Gardens of the World has listed the globe's most 'spectacular classic and contemporary gardens'. Here is our pick of the book's most awe-inspiring leafy havens...

item.title: Pictured: SpaceWalk, the 80ft-high staircase in South Korea that's shaped like a ROLLER COASTER
item.description: 'SpaceWalk' in Pohang, South Korea, is designed to feel like a 'walk through space'. Visitors are rewarded with a 'magnificent' view of Pohang and Yeongil Bay.

item.title: UK hotel review: The Inspector calls at The George Inn, a thatched pub-with-rooms in the Cotswolds
item.description: The Inspector pays £110 for bed and breakfast at The George Inn near the village of Barford St Michael, near Banbury. Read on to find out why he gives it four stars...

item.title: Fascinating book shows how British caravans have transformed over the past 100 years
item.description: The book charts the evolution of UK caravanning, 'from its beginnings as a rich man's interest to [becoming] the holiday of choice for the everyday family'.

item.title: Paris hotel review: Inside the French capital's Shangri-La, which boasts amazing Eiffel Tower views
item.description: Ted Thornhill checks into an Eiffel Tower View room - and is astonished by the view of Gustav's handiwork. He is also bowled over by the Shang Palace Chinese eatery...

item.title: Weligama Sri Lanka: New flats start from £114k
item.description: Southbeach Weligama is a new development of 106 flats in Sri Lanka, with prices ranging from £114k for a one-bed flat, to £832,978 for a four-bedroom flat.

item.title: The Holiday Guru answers readers' travel questions about cancelled flights, airport queues and more
item.description: Here, the Guru also helps a reader with a query about ferry crossings and advises another on the lesser-visited counties to explore on a staycation.

item.title: Graz for under £100 a night: The joys of Arnold Schwarzenegger's birthplace in Austria on a budget
item.description: Graz offers so much: a youthful feel thanks to four universities, plus festivals and delicious food. On a weekend break, stay at the Hotel Weitzer on the River Mur and dine at the hilltop restaurant Aiola.

item.title: Scotland hotel review: Inside Killiecrankie House in Perthshire
item.description: Sarah Turner checks into Killiecrankie House, which is just 90 minutes from both Edinburgh and Glasgow. It's run by a chef and wine expert, so the dining is exceptional...

item.title: Photographer's stunning shots show that the Lake District is mesmerising, whatever the weather
item.description: Photographer Ross Davidson takes mesmerising photos of the Lake District in moody weather. Read on for our pick of his most sensational pictures...

item.title: Empty roads, awesome landscapes - a road trip through beautiful Oman is packed with pleasures
item.description: Clare Mann finds road-tripping through Oman is a 'doddle'. She visits Nizwa, the ancient capital of Oman, and stays at a luxury desert camp in Wahiba Sands.

item.title: The joys of a SWITZERLAND beach break: Finding sands to rival the French Riviera on Lake Geneva
item.description: Lake Geneva's waters are so blue you'd be forgiven for thinking you had landed in Greece if it weren't for the snow-dusted Alps in the distance, says Katja Gaskell.

item.title: Savouring Cambodia's sights, sounds and fiery dishes on a whistlestop cooking tour
item.description: Jeff Mills embarks on a mission not only to sample the best Cambodian food, but to learn how to cook it, too. Highlights include a cooking class with local star chef Rotanak Ros.

item.title: The best ways to dodge a holiday car hire nightmare
item.description: Every week our Holiday Hero Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a brilliant holiday topic, doing all the legwork so you don't have to. This week: how to avoid a car hire crisis.

item.title: Exclusive for Mail on Sunday readers: Meet your favourite authors on a superb cruise of the Danube
item.description: Mingle with some top writers while enjoying wonderful food and drink and breathtaking vistas on this eight-day Henley Literary Festival cruise through the heart of Europe.

item.title: Renew your passport now - it could take TEN weeks
item.description: The Passport Office is expecting an unprecedented wave of applications following two years of pandemic travel restrictions.

item.title: 'The Holy Land is turning into Disneyland': Christians leaving Jerusalem due to hate crimes
item.description: At Easter the Little Petra guesthouse (pictured) in the heart of Jerusalem's Christian quarter should be bustling with pilgrims. Instead, the only 'guests' are a group of Jewish settlers.

item.title: The world's growing cityscapes: From London to Sydney
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: From London to Tokyo, these before-and-after shots give a brilliant insight of each city from two - in some cases vastly different - periods in time.

item.title: Cornwall holidays: Discovering the 'ridiculously pretty' village of Mousehole
item.description: Spend a morning on Mousehole's secluded beach before wandering through local artist Essex Tyler's gallery. As evening falls, unwind with a drink at the village's Old Coastguard Hotel.

item.title: Iconic Venice landmark opens doors to public for first time in 500 YEARS after major renovation
item.description: The Procuratie Vecchie in St Mark's Square is one of the Italian city's most recognised facades, forming the colonnaded perimeter of the piazza.

item.title: Hogwarts in New York! Inside the hidden Manhattan restaurant you enter by stepping behind a PAINTING
item.description: Guests enter Frevo, in Greenwich Village, Hogwarts-common-room-style. Behind the art is a 14-seat counter. Ted Thornhill watches the chefs work their magic...

item.title: Over-friendly seal sent to rehab to wean her off human contact
item.description: Spearmint, a North Atlantic grey seal, is frequently spotted around Plymouth Sound in Devon after rescuers say she became 'habituated to humans' who regularly fed her.

item.title: Who needs the Maldives! Why we're smitten with the Isles of Scilly off Cornwall's coast
item.description: Angelina Villa-Clarke takes a boat from Bryher to St Martin's and is mesmerised to see dolphins leaping from the water. Read on for more on her trip to the islands...

item.title: Italy holidays: Foodies will adore Bologna - and its exquisite architecture is a tasty treat, too
item.description: With the 'comfortable and idiosyncratic' Art Hotel Commercianti as your base, explore Bologna's small historic centre, its wine bars, and try its handmade tortellini.

item.title: Sick dolphin that washed ashore in Texas dies after beachgoers tried to RIDE it
item.description: A sick dolphin that washed ashore in Texas died after beachgoers attempted to ride it, and now those involved are facing a possible harassment investigation.

item.title: Footage emerges of garbage and polluted seas after tourists return to Bali
item.description: Bali's 'trash emergency' is back on after shocking video showed a 'garbage soup' flowing into the ocean at Seminyak a month after the reopening of the island paradise to tourists.

item.title: Europe's best sleeper trains revealed, from Vienna to Venice
item.description: Every week our Holiday Hero Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a holiday topic, doing all the legwork so you don't have to. This week: crossing Europe by night train.

item.title: P&O Ferries suspends ALL passenger services across Channel over Easter
item.description: The ferry firm last night revealed it would not run any passenger services between Dover and Calais this weekend, dashing the holiday hopes of thousands.

item.title: Fascinating book of vintage photo postcards reveals life in the U.S during the early 20th century
item.description: Real Photo Postcards: Pictures from a Changing Nation explains how 'photo postcards' became 'omnipresent' in the U.S at the turn of the century.

item.title: Couple set up England's smallest distillery in their garden SHED
item.description: Stewart Bridge and Claire Ashford have been running their tiny production line for Little Devil Distillery from behind their bungalow in Irchester, Northants since the height of the pandemic lockdown.

item.title: Having a swell time! Kitesurfer tackles a 50ft wave in Portugal on an electric FLYING surfboard
item.description: New footage shows Tom Court, a British surfer mastering the waves using an efoil off the coast of Nazaré, Portugal.

item.title: Rodent mad woman who bathes her 50 pet rats in kitchen sink goes viral
item.description: Since receiving her first few rats in 2018, Michele Raybon, 51, from Palmdale, California, has not been able to stop adding to her mischievous pack, and now owns 50 of the 'cuddly' critters.

item.title: Photos show furious DOLPHIN attacking trainer in front of horrified families at Miami Seaquarium
item.description: A spectator captured the moment a dolphin at the Miami Seaquarium went rogue, diverting from its choreography to attack its trainer on Saturday and horrifying the audience.

item.title: Pictured: The amazing UFO-style floating hotel suite that comes with a retractable roof and a motor
item.description: The 'Pearlsuite', dreamt up by an Italian design company, would be able to pootle around bays for up to six hours, with guests controlling them using their smartphones.

item.title: Elizabeth Hurley is slammed by fans for holding 'delicate' starfish
item.description: The actress, 56, showed off her incredible physique in a blue bikini recently but many have called her out for taking the animals out of the water as they could die.

item.title: Golden Hellos to tackle staff crisis: BA offers £1,000 welcome bonus to lure cabin crew members
item.description: Companies are being forced to offer salary boosts, cash bonuses or attractive benefits packages across various sectors in the UK including airlines, hospitality and healthcare.

item.title: Cornwall hotel review: The delights of the recently restored Fowey Harbour Hotel
item.description: During her stay, Vicki Reeve finds that the hotel is 'perfectly placed' to explore the 'pretty harbour town' of Fowey. She stays in a large Superior Seaview room and wakes to the sound of the waves.

item.title: Staggering drone images reveal 11 heron nests perched on 100ft treetops at 17th century stately home
item.description: The amazing pictures captured the scenes at Belton House in Grantham, Lincs. It is the first time a drone has been used for the British Trust for Ornithology's (BTO) annual census.

item.title: Giant apartment blocks to spell out the word HOME in a former U.S army barracks in Germany
item.description: The eye-catching new development will be in the Franklin Mitte neighbourhood in Mannheim, Germany, and is scheduled for completion in 2025.

item.title: Gilded Age New York time capsule mansion on sale for $33M
item.description: Situated in the Murray Hill neighborhood of Manhattan, the quaint townhouse gives prospective owners the chance to travel back in time.

item.title: Pet owners have shared hilarious images of cats and dogs who won't give them any privacy
item.description: Owners from around the world have shared snaps of their furry friends being extra needy at inappropriate times, including four cats staring down their owner who was relaxing in the bath.

item.title: Maldives resort review: Toploader's DAN HIPGRAVE is wowed by Milaidhoo Island
item.description: Dan says Milaidhoo is 'off the charts' - a world-class boutique resort set over 13 acres atop the Baa Atoll's beautiful Unesco Biosphere Reserve.

item.title: Traveller films her trip on Virgin Voyages' new adult-only cruise ship Valiant Lady
item.description: Jo Kessel films her cruise on Virgin Voyages' new ship, and says: Valiant Lady might not appeal to conventional cruisers, but dare to embrace the difference and you'll be pleased you did.'

item.title: UK hotel review: The Inspector checks in to Wiltshire's Bell & Crown pub with rooms
item.description: The Inspector describes the former coaching inn - which is set in the village of Zeals - as having 'engaging staff, original art and locally sourced food'. Read on to find out why he gives it four stars...

item.title: Grade II-listed fisherman's cottage used as Doc Martin's surgery on the market for £1.25million
item.description: A famous house in Cornwall (pictured) which features as ITV's Doc Martin's home and GP surgery is now on the market for £1.25million.

item.title: Walker spots eyes and nose in the rocks at Cornish beauty spot after landslide
item.description: Louise Coe, 45, was walking the coast path at Bedruthan Steps, near Padstow, Cornwall, when she noticed a pair of eyes and a nose staring back at her.

item.title: TV presenter Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen talks about his travels
item.description: This week, TV presenter Laurence Llewelyn-Bowen checks into our travel Q&A. He also talks about exploring the Big Apple in his teens, the Bavarian castle that he's dreaming of visiting - and more.

item.title: German airline Condor unveils planes painted like beach towels
item.description: German airline Condor has given some of its planes a striped livery that it says is 'inspired by parasols, bath towels and beach chairs'. 'Vacation is stripes,' says the charter carrier.

item.title: Easter holiday airport chaos: Brits warned to brace for disruption on Good Friday and Easter Monday
item.description: Millions of holidaymakers are expect to pass through UK airports across this Easter weekend - with experts warning of major delays on Good Friday and Easter Monday.

item.title: Why weren't airports ready for lift-off after lockdown?
item.description: MARK PALMER: It's not short-sightedness but a case of being blind to a problem that was inevitable without incisive leadership and proper planning. Both have been sadly lacking.

item.title: The winning images of the 2022 Sony World Photography Awards
item.description: British photographer Scott Wilson's shot of a mustang in Colorado won the Open competition, while Australian photographer Adam Ferguson bagged the Photographer of the Year title.

item.title: Pictured: The tiny chapel in the Channel Islands that measures just 16ft by 9ft
item.description: The bijou place of worship, on Guernsey, is decorated with thousands of seashells, pebbles, and pieces of broken china. Sadie Whitelocks steps inside...

item.title: Brits told to brace for summer of airport chaos as airlines struggle with low staff numbers
item.description: Airlines are concerned that failure to address the current issues will lead to travel chaos extending into the summer, with some families having already endured three-hour queues.

item.title: Hunt for daredevils who climbed onto the top of a crane in Surfers Paradise for social media likes
item.description: The young daredevils filmed themselves dangling from dangerous heights on top of a crane off a Meriton high rise construction site in Surfers Paradise.

item.title: A guide to stress-free travel, from avoiding airport queues to navigating cancelled ferries
item.description: With Easter looming and overseas holiday sales almost back to pre-Covid levels, airlines and airports are struggling to cope. But you can avoid much of the chaos this Easter. Here's our lowdown.

item.title: Exclusive for Mail on Sunday readers: A once-in-a-decade chance to see Bavaria and its Passion Play
item.description: This exclusive five-night trip includes an appearance by Graham-Dixon at the 'fairytale' Neuschwanstein Castle, where he'll give a talk and take part in a Q&A session.

item.title: UK Easter trips: A guide to the best gardens and egg hunts
item.description: Many of these gardens have Easter Egg hunts or adventure walks that families will love, from the Lost Gardens of Heligan in Cornwall to Wales's Bodnant Garden.

item.title: Green revamp to lure bankers back to their Canary Wharf offices
item.description: Canary Wharf is teaming up with The Eden Project to create a 'green spine' running through London's towering financial district.

item.title: Is this New York's most exquisite (and nicest-smelling) hotel? A review of the 114-room Baccarat
item.description: The Baccarat Hotel has a noble design aesthetic reminiscent of 18th-century France and is part of the legendary French Baccarat crystal brand. Ted Thornhill is dazzled...

item.title: Betty White's idyllic beachfront estate FINDS BUYER for $8million
item.description: Betty White's idyllic beachfront estate in the picturesque California town of Carmel-by-the-sea has reportedly found a buyer for its whopping asking price of $8 million, with the sale pending.

item.title: U.S holidays: The best places to chill out in New York, from hotels to independent bookshops
item.description: If you're looking for a slice of serene in New York City, here's our guide to some of the best pockets of calm to check out, from museums to hotels to tucked-away restaurants.

item.title: Pictured: The £25million Oceandiva London superyacht that will cruise up and down the Thames in 2022
item.description: Renderings show the Oceandiva London ship will have a stylish bar area, a spot-lit dance floor with a stage, and will cruise past some of London's most iconic landmarks.

item.title: World's skinniest skyscraper ready to welcome its first residents to Manhattan's Billionaire's Row
item.description: Steinway Tower stands on Billionaires' Row in Manhattan at 1,428 feet tall - but just 57 feet wide. It is the slenderest building in the world and one of the tallest buildings in the Western hemisphere.

item.title: Grade II listed castle in West Sussex hits the market for £6.25 million
item.description: A stunning West Sussex castle and 120 acres of surrounding estate which built in the 18th century and was once home to Hollywood legend Judy Garland has hit the market for £6.25 million

item.title: Squirrel sneaks into bin and eats so many nuts it struggles to squeeze out again
item.description: The squirrel made an opening in the garden storage bin of Roy Rimmer from Wigan, Greater Manchester and found the bulk buy sunflower seeds that he feeds to the birds.

item.title: The fiery power of Hawaii's Kilauea volcano captured in series of stunning images
item.description: The red-hot photo series showing glowing lava spurting out of the Kilauea volcano on the Big Island and into the sea was captured by San Francisco-based Michael Shainblum.

item.title: 11ft-wide six-storey London home complete with lift between floors goes on the market for £2million
item.description: A three-bedroom glass house (pictured) has gone up for sale in Golden Lane, close to the Barbican in Clerkenwell, London, for a whopping £2million but it's a bit of a tight squeeze inside.

item.title: UK travel: Holidaying like the rich and famous on Osea Island, Essex's answer to Branson's Necker
item.description: Max Davidson stays in a cottage on Osea Island, which has been turned into a high-end staycation venue. He describes the isle as 'quintessentially English in both its scenery and its ambience'.

item.title: Southwest Airlines hosts TOILET PAPER race while delayed in Chicago [Video]
item.description: Passengers were stuck on a plane waiting to take off from Chicago Midway International Airport on Sunday when flight attendants came up with an idea to pass the time.

item.title: Protect your post pandemic holiday and don't end up out of pocket
item.description: Britons jetting off on holiday must now navigate mobile roaming charges, redrawn insurance rules and ever-changing compensation criteria.

item.title: Africa holidays: Why Namibia promises an epic safari like no other, from dunes to hot air balloons
item.description: Kate Eshelby checks into Kwessi Dunes in Namibia. The camouflaged camp, which opened in March 2020, offers 12 canvas bungalows, each 'backed by sunset-red sand dunes' of the NamibRand.

item.title: Japan and Singapore have the world's most powerful passports, while the UK moves up to 5th place
item.description: The ranking, produced by the Henley Passport Index, found that passport holders in Japan and Singapore can visit 192 countries visa-free, while UK citizens can visit 187 countries without a visa.

item.title: #ShotOnMyDrone award winners announced by CAA
item.description: The Civil Aviation Authority ran the competition for aerial photographs to encourage drone users to fly responsibly to show you can get stunning images keeping to the rules.

item.title: The perfect nature escape: Travellers dub Mossman Gorge in the Daintree rainforest a 'must-see'
item.description: Adventure-seeking Australians have dubbed Mossman Gorge in the Daintree Rainforest as the new travel must-see for it's stunning crystal clear swimming holes and picturesque scenery.

item.title: Treehouses for adults: Live out your Peter Pan dreams in these extraordinary treetop hideaways
item.description: Touring over 36 structures around the world, Treetop Hideaways: Treehouses for Adults by Philip Jodidio aims to inspire readers with architecturally stunning buildings.

item.title: Golden tips for older travellers, from finding affordable insurance to sorting airport parking
item.description: Fiddly rules and hidden charges can make travelling the world in later years exceedingly tricky - and expensive. Here's how to avoid the common pitfalls.

item.title: Lion with a very impressive mane looks like he's just left the hair salon
item.description: The photogenic feline called Tom, five, posed wide-eyed with his mane blowing in the wind amid the glistening snow at Zoopark Na Hrádečku in Czech Republic.

item.title: Magical Britain: Bewitching travel guide reveals the most mysterious spots in the UK
item.description: Hoping to preserve an 'enchanted Britain', Magical Britain reveals over 650 mysterious sites. Author Rob Wildwood has spent over 10 years documenting Britain's fables.

item.title: ISS photo taken from the ground shows two astronauts performing a spacewalk
item.description: The photo, taken by award-winning German photographer Sebastian Voltmer, is believed to be the first ground-based image of two ISS astronauts spacewalking.

item.title: UK hotel review: The Inspector stays at London's Room2, the 'world's first carbon-neutral hotel'
item.description: The Inspector says that his room in the Chiswick hotel has 'a 1970s retro vibe to it'. During his stay, he explores the hotel's 'industrial chic' restaurant and pay-as-you-go coffee bar.

item.title: The 2021 World Nature Photography Awards winners revealed
item.description: The World Nature Photography Awards has announced its winners from an incredible pool of entries from 20 countries across six continents - and the photos are astounding.

item.title: Two six-tonne bull elephants noisily lock tusks as they battle for supremacy in Masai Mara [VIDEO]
item.description: Footage taken from the Kenyan game reserve at the start of March shows the two elephants squaring up to each other before locking tusks in a dramatic attempt to show their dominance.

item.title: Staycation travel: Exploring the workers' village at the soap factory in Port Sunlight, Merseyside
item.description: On a tour of Port Sunlight, Tina Ediss admires the 'skilfully constructed' houses built by the industrialist William Lever in the worker's village, where she finds that the 'leafy streets are deserted'.

item.title: U.S holidays: Explore California's picture-perfect Napa Valley, where you'll find over 400 wineries
item.description: Every week our Holiday Hero Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a brilliant holiday topic, doing all the legwork so you don't have to. This week: Vineyards near San Francisco.

item.title: Inside Italy's Cervinia, one of the best-value ski resorts in the world
item.description: Neil English discovers that ski expenses in Cervinia don't break the bank. The resort shares 217 miles of ski area trails with Zermatt in Switzerland, and boasts 'loads of off-piste to boot', he reveals.

item.title: Discovering LA is perfect for a family getaway... and it can be cheaper to get to than the Canaries
item.description: Joanna Tweedy and her family have 'bucketsful' of fun on America's West Coast, with holiday highlights including a trip to Newport Beach and a day at Universal Studios Hollywood.

item.title: Iconic Beatrix Potter character Peter Rabbit will mark 120th anniversary on special £5 coin
item.description: Launched today, it is available on the Royal Mint's website together with a gold and silver edition. The coin will not enter circulation.

item.title: A women spent two years transforming her 1980s bungalow into a chic home using DIY hacks
item.description: Michaela Shoebridge, 35, from Kingston upon Hull, spent two years transforming her 1980s bungalow into a chic, contemporary home using cost-cutting DIY hacks.

item.title: Spain holidays: Family magic in the refreshingly unglamorous south-east of Majorca
item.description: Mark Palmer and his family stay in a Vintage Travel villa called Sa Marina near the Majorcan village of S'Horta, and quickly develop a 'strong affection' for 'this lesser-known part of Majorca'.

item.title: UK's best walks revealed by Which? - number one is a route that includes a spot from Harry Potter
item.description: The top-ranking route in the Which? survey takes in Malham Cove in Yorkshire, which has cliffs that lead up to a limestone pavement where the scene from Harry Potter was filmed.

item.title: UK holidays: The joys of a 'cow cuddling' experience at Rutland's Ahimsa Farm
item.description: Rob Crossan visits Ahimsa farm in Rutland, where he gets the chance to hug a cow called Poppy. 'As therapies go, it's novel and harmless - and my affection for cows has soared,' he says.

item.title: British daredevil dangles from the rafters of the 262ft San Siro stadium in Milan [Video]
item.description: Adrenaline junkie Adam Lockwood, 20, filmed himself dangling above the concrete concourse after scaling his way to the top of the sports ground, home to both AC Milan and Inter Milan, on Tuesday.

item.title: Pinterest and Argos unveil new hotel rooms inspired by the 'hottest interiors trends online'
item.description: The 'Argos Mood Hotel' - a concept in London's Bethnal Green designed with the help of Pinterest - is made up of six 'Mood Rooms', from a gold-accented 'Luxe Room' to a 'Play Room' for adults.

item.title: Candid TikTok video of passengers on Scotland-bound LNER train goes viral
item.description: Student Aisha Khan filmed an LNER passenger train that her train was overtaking - with the resulting TikTok clip garnering around three million views.

item.title: Two adorable Giant Galapagos tortoises are born at a British zoo for the first time
item.description: The hatchlings were born at Crocodiles of the World in Oxfordshire, having been fathered by a 70-year-old male in 'peak physical condition' called Dirk.

item.title: Intoxicating Madeira: The Portuguese island bursts into life in spring
item.description: During his time on the island, Nigel Tisdall goes on a trip to the 25 Fontes waterfalls, soaks in the 'fairytale beauty' of the laurisilva forest, and visits the Atelier Vicente museum in Funchal.

item.title: We take an exclusive first passenger ride in Rolls-Royce's Spectre EV
item.description: We've had an exclusive ride in the new green all-electric Rolls-Royce Spectre - the first zero-emissions battery-powered limousine from the world's most luxurious car-maker.

item.title: The best-designed homes of 2022 revealed in the American Institute of Architects Housing Awards
item.description: The awards showcase 'excellent design in the 21st century'. Travelling from North America's Rocky Mountains to the Brazilian jungle, here's our pick of the stunning award-winning homes...

item.title: Huge sperm whale gets lost off Shetland and needs help from islanders to nudge it to freedom
item.description: The whale, thought to be an adult male, measured around 45 feet and had no signs of injury. It is believed to have got lost and ended up in waters much too shallow for its species.

item.title: Malta holidays: Checking out the world-class restaurants now making the island a gourmet destination
item.description: Neil Simpson says that food-lovers should start their adventure at Ion Harbour in Valletta, before heading to the Michelin-starred De Mondion restaurant in the ancient walled city of Mdina.

item.title: The amazing shortlisted innovations in the 2022 Crystal Cabin Awards, the 'Oscars' of airline design
item.description: The winners of the 2022 Crystal Cabin awards, which celebrates the 'future of the aircraft passenger experience', will be revealed at the Aircraft Interiors Expo in Hamburg this June.

item.title: UK hotel review: The Inspector stays in a room with a runway view at Heathrow's Hilton Garden Inn
item.description: The Inspector says that he 'wouldn't hesitate to come back' to the Hilton Garden Inn at Heathrow Terminals 2 and 3. 'People are sniffy about airport hotels, but I've always liked them,' he admits.

item.title: World's longest suspension bridge opens in Turkey
item.description: The '1915 Canakkale Bridge' allows travellers to cross the Dardanelles in six minutes compared to the previous 90 by ferry, and brings a 415million-euro saving in fuel.

item.title: The struggle to save Bangkok's architectural heritage (and how scuba divers are helping)
item.description: Dive instructor Poosak Posayachinda owns a 200-year-old Chinese mansion in Bangkok, but it lives on thanks largely to his decision to convert it into a scuba academy.

item.title: After years of conflict, Iraq is enjoying a 'mini-boom' in tourism
item.description: After years of conflict, Iraq is enjoying a 'mini-boom' in tourism - meet the brave visitors who are rewarded with ancient cities and 'happy', 'generous' locals.

item.title: Italy holidays: Seeing Raphael's masterpieces up close in Rome ahead of a new exhibition of his work
item.description: Deirdre Fernand visits Rome's Palazzo Barberini to see the painter's 'luscious' portrait of his muse and great La Fornarina and admires his frescoes in the Vatican Museum.

item.title: Paramedics in the Lake District are testing JET PACKS that could help them reach people in minutes
item.description: The flying suit, developed by inventor Richard Browning from Gravity Industries, is currently being tested by a few brave paramedics with The Great North Air Ambulance Service (GNAAS).

item.title: Adorable moment dog owner gives his frightened collie a piggyback up an escalator [Video]
item.description: Adorable footage shows the unnamed owner giving Tyson the border collie a piggyback up an outdoor escalator in Seville, Spain, on March 11. The doting owner even holds his umbrella over the dog.

item.title: Annie Leibovitz launches campaign to change the meaning of 'all-inclusive' holiday
item.description: The global campaign, in partnership with Celebrity Cruises, wants to 'improve the representation of all people who travel in marketing materials'.
item.media:credit: Annie Leibovitz via PinPep / Jarrad Seng via PinPep / Naima Green via PinPep / Giles Duley via PinPep

item.title: Rightmove: Five most viewed UK homes revealed
item.description: Britons browsing the property portal site are clearly still dreaming about living in a spacious home by the coast or in the countryside brimming with character and history.

item.title: Flamingo that escaped from a Kansas zoo 17 years ago during a storm is found alive in Texas
item.description: No. 492 has been spotted several times in Wisconsin, Louisiana and Texas since its escape, however its companion has not been seen in years. Officials believe the bird is 27 years old.
item.media:credit: Facebook / Ben Shepard / Coastal Fisheries / Facebook

item.title: York's 800-year-old Clifford's Tower and its epic new viewing platform unveiled after £5m makeover
item.description: The transformation of what was York Castle's 800-year-old keep has been 19 years in the making. The castle - built for King Henry III in the 1200s - features unusually luxurious fixtures.

item.title: Inside Chicago's Chess Studios, where The Rolling Stones and Muddy Waters recorded songs
item.description: 'This place changed music and the world,' says Janine Judge, the executive director of Willie Dixon's Blues Heaven, the nonprofit that offers tours of Chess Records.

item.title: Cathay Pacific launches world record 10,326-mile New York to Hong Kong flight, avoiding Russia
item.description: Cathay Airlines will create the world's longest commercial flight route after tweaking its New York-Hong Kong flight to avoid Russian airspace. It will add almost two hours to the flight.

item.title: Pompeii enlists Spot the robot dog to inspect the ancient city's streets
item.description: Spot, the nimble four-legged robot dog created by US firm Boston Dynamics, is using its cameras to provide a feed of hard-to-reach Pompeii structures.

item.title: Mother rhino charges at safari jeep as she protects her bleeding calf from a tiger in India [video]
item.description: Nilesh Shah, 44, was on a tour through Kaziranga National Park, India at the start of March. His guide was forced to reverse after a rhino and her calf, who were escaping a tiger, charged at them.

item.title: Medieval Scottish Airbnb castle is named 'hottest property' in the UK and Ireland
item.description: Kilmartin Castle, in Argyll, was handed the accolade at a virtual ceremony for the 2022 Eviivo Awards. Each award winner was announced by David Hasselhoff.

item.title: 'Digital archaeologists' secretly scan Elgin Marbles inside the British Museum
item.description: Experts from the Oxford-based Institute for Digital Archaeology hope marble blocks can be created with metal chisels, in much the same way the sculptures were created by ancient Greek architect Phidias.

item.title: Social media users share the craziest notices from people they live next to
item.description: The Twitter account, Best of Nextdoor keeps track of hilarious posts from users from around on the app Next Door, with the best examples collated in a gallery by Why These.

item.title: Rhodes holidays: Stepping away from the crowds and discovering this Greek island's ancient history
item.description: With the Lindos Grand Resort & Spa as her base, Kate Johnson explores the medieval streets of Rhodes and pays a visit to the waterfall and the freshwater lake of Seven Springs.

item.title: World's cosiest caravans: New book shows beautiful 'rolling homes' created for a life on the road
item.description: The Modern Caravan, by Kate Oliver, goes through the keyhole of some of the most eye-catching 'rolling homes' from around the world.

item.title: Amazing travel guide reveals the best places to visit for adventure in unspoiled Scotland
item.description: Amazing travel guide Wild Guide Scotland reveals the best places to visit for adventure in the country. It reveals over 700 secret spots illustrated with a treasure trove of photos.

item.title: Inside jetBlue's economy Core cabin from London Gatwick to New York - then returning first class
item.description: New York-based JetBlue said its 'Core' cabin would 'reinvent what it's like to fly economy across the Atlantic'. Ted Thornhill puts that claim to the test - then enjoys 22.7 sq ft of space on the return journey.

item.title: UK hotel review: Inside The Ship in Dunwich, Suffolk
item.description: The Ship in Dunwich, Suffolk, is a pub with a long history - it harks right back to the Middle Ages. Lizzie Enfield checks in and finds the bedrooms come with complimentary port.

item.title: Snaking through the Australian Outback on The Ghan, the world's longest passenger train
item.description: Claudia Joseph boards The Ghan for an unforgettable train journey from Darwin to Adelaide. She says it ranks as one of life's bucket-list experiences.

item.title: Exclusive for Mail on Sunday readers: Visit the top gardens of Somerset with David Domoney
item.description: Our five-day itinerary has been designed to give you a real taste of Somerset life, with trips to several of the area's picture-perfect gardens and an inspiring talk from horticulturist David Domoney.

item.title: Best Easter egg hunts and chocolate tasting sessions across the UK
item.description: Every week our Holiday Hero Neil Simpson takes an in-depth look at a brilliant holiday topic, doing all the legwork so you don't have to. This week: Tasting trips and treats for Easter.

item.title: Social media users share scary toys that should never have been made
item.description: Social media users from around the world have shared snaps of the most terrifying kid's toys, with the best examples collated in a gallery by Bored Panda.

item.title: England's oldest strip of beach huts in Felixstowe faces bulldozer
item.description: Beach huts in Felixstowe have overlooked the sea for almost 140 years and are said to have been the first in the country - but East Suffolk Council has said beach erosion means they have to be moved.

item.title: Thailand holidays: Why this dreamy stretch of Phuket is the cultured side of a holiday hotspot
item.description: Kim Fletcher checks into the 'elegant' Anantara Mai Khao on the island for a week and samples local cuisine in a street market, visits an elephant sanctuary and explores Phuket Old Town.
